summary: Establish performance and safety baseline for long-form editor input
problem_statement: Before introducing any auto-correction or editor mutation, the current editorâ€™s performance, undo behavior, and data safety characteristics for long-form writing are unknown. Without a baseline, it is impossible to evaluate regressions or determine safe intervention thresholds.
in_scope: Measure typing latency for small, medium, and large documents
Observe browser undo/redo behavior under programmatic text changes
Identify document size limits and database constraints
Assess risk of data loss due to lack of autosave or draft persistence
requirements: Baseline typing latency measurements are recorded
Undo/redo behavior under mutation is documented
Document size thresholds and risks are identified
acceptance_criteria: A baseline report exists and is linked from the issue
Known performance and safety risks are explicitly listed
No editor behavior has been modified
dependencies: Ability to run the editor locally
risks: Hidden performance degradation at large document sizes
Undo stack corruption when text is mutated
Silent data loss due to missing draft persistence
implementation_notes: This is an observational and measurement task only. Do not introduce fixes or mitigations. The goal is to make current limits visible before changing behavior.
